result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.
Justice Point Pretrial Services AMENDED Status Report, filed.

Defendant Ashanti Peterson appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Ashanti Peterson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. Court grants request for adjournment and advises defendant that an in-person appearance is required. Court addressed JusticePoint violation. Statements by parties. Court advised defendant to maintain contact. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pretrial Supervision Report

Defendant Ashanti Peterson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ashanti Peterson appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard via ZOOM.
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report, filed.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Status Report 07-19-2022

Defendant Ashanti Peterson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Calendar Call.  Defendant appears via zoom. Court Canceled stayed bench warrant. 
Defense counsel  request additional time to discuss this case with the defendant. 
Court ordered this case adjourned.   Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Calendar Call. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense counsel advises the court he has no explanation of defendant's non appearance.
Court ordered Bench Warrant Issued. Remand to Commissioner  and No action on bail.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Status Conference. 
DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance and  request a calendar call date.  
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner and no action on bail and STAYED issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be in person.  Calendar call scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Parties advised this hearing will be held Remotely-via zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

received and filed.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Status Conference.  
Defendant logged onto Zoom but did not wait for case to be called. Court waived defendant's appearance for today's purposes.

Attorney Krejci to notify  the SPD Office new counsel needs to be appointed and defendant of the new date.

Pretrial Services Supervision Report.
JOHN KREJCI, received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. 
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ashanti Peterson in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Ashanti Peterson in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ashanti Peterson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jaylyn H.; Metro Market
